The mission of Lake McMurtry Friends is to enrich the quality of life by providing opportunities to engage in sustainable outdoor recreation, environmental education, and nature conservation. Contact Information 405-747-8085 Info@lakemcmurtry.org After Hours Contact East Camp Host 405-747-4688 ranger@lakemcmurtry.org West Camp Host 405-858-0203 camphost@lakemcmurtry.org Stillwater Police Department 405-372-4171 Amenities Adventure Camp Camping Disk Golf Fishing Hiking and Mountain Biking Kayaking Pavilion Rentals
//About Us Strings Park Info Rules Wildlife History Educational Partners Contact //general info Our Mission Our Purpose The mission of Lake McMurtry Friends is to enrich quality of life by providing opportunities to engage in sustainable outdoor recreation, environmental education and nature conservation. Lake McMurtry Friends, Inc. was formed to manage and protect the lake, but more than that we are organized to promote outdoor recreation and leisure, scientific and educational study, and community involvement. We are a small group of individuals who want to see Lake McMurtry succeed and continue to be available to the general public for generations to come. After all this park belongs to the people of our community and we wish to represent that each and every day!
Lake McMurtry Friends, Inc. is a private 501 (c)3 non-profit organization. //Rules - Permits are required for all vehicles and activities within the park. "\n"- Check In 3pm , Check out 1pm "\n"- All sites are reserveable online 24/7 therefore you must check in with park staff to camp. "\n"- Alcoholic beverages are prohibited on all Lake McMurtry property. "\n"- Daily permits expire at 10:00 pm. "\n"- Quiet hours are from 10:00 pm to 7:00 am. Generators are generally not permitted, please check with park staff for more information. "\n"- The discharging of firearms, BB guns, paintball guns, bow and arrows, sling shots or any devices that use burning powder, explosives, compressed gases, etc. is prohibited. "\n"- Pets must be kept on leashes no longer than 10 feet and under control at all times. "\n"- Fireworks and bonfires are prohibited. "\n"- Confetti is prohibited. "\n"- Removal of plants, animals, rocks, downed timber, artifacts or relics is prohibited without written permission from Lake McMurtry Friends, Inc. and/or the City of Stillwater. "\n"- The use of ATVs, LSVs, UTVs, and golf carts is prohibited on Lake McMurtry property. //wildlife Deer Diversity Bird Diversity Invasive Species //birds aren't even fucking real Bird Diversity at Lake McMurtry
Bird watchers and wildlife enthusiasts! Lake McMurtry is a great place to spend the day searching for all your favorite bird species. Who knows, you may just find a bird you have never seen. With temperatures climbing and daylight hours ever so slowly starting to increase, migratory bird species are beginning to show. Due the variety of habitats at Lake McMurtry, there are a multitude of birds that can be found; each habitat type will support different bird species. Habitats at the lake encompass: grasslands, wetlands, open water, mature forest, and early successional habitats. With our 30+ miles of multiuse trails it allows you to explore all the different habitat types and capture a rich bird diversity. Be sure to share all of your Lake McMurtry bird photos by emailing them to info@lakemcmurtry.org or post them to our Facebook at Lake McMurtry Friends!
